detaileddescription.para:
6041h - The statusword indicates the current state of the drive. No bits are latched. The statusword consist of bits for:
the current state of the drive,
the operating state of the mode and
manufacturer specific options.

6040h - The controlword consist of bits for:
the controlling of the state,
the controlling of operating modes and
manufacturer specific options.
6060h - The parameter modes of operation switches the actually choosen operation mode.
6061h - The modes of operation display shows the current mode of operation. The meaning of the returned value corresponds to that of the modes of operation option code

607Ah - The target position is the position that the drive should move to in position profile mode using the current settings of motion control parameters such as velocity, acceleration, deceleration, motion profile type etc. The target position is given in user defined position units. It is converted to position increments using the position factor. The target position will be interpreted as absolute or relative depending on the ‘abs / rel' flag in the controlword.

6081h - The profile velocity is the velocity normally attained at the end of the acceleration ramp during a profiled move and is valid for both directions of motion. The profile velocity is given in user defined speed units. It is converted to position increments per second using the velocity encoder factor.
60FFh - The target velocity is the input for the trajectory generator and the value is given in velocity units.
6071h - This parameter is the input value for the torque controller in profile torque mode and the value is given per thousand of rated torque.
6083h - The profile acceleration is given in user defined acceleration units. It is converted to position increments per second 2 using the normalizing factors.
6084h - The profile deceleration is given in the same units as profile acceleration. If this parameter is not supported, then the profile acceleration value is also used for deceleration.
6064h - This object represents the actual value of the position measurement device in user defined units.
606Ch - The velocity actual value is also represented in velocity units and is coupled to the velocity used as input to the velocity controller.
6077h - The torque actual value corresponds to the instantaneous torque in the drive motor. The value is given per thousand of rated torque.
6098h - The homing method object determines the method that will be used during homing.
6099h01 - Speed during search for switch.
6099h02 - Speed during search for zero
CIA 402 CANopen Driver
The positioning of the drive is defined in this mode. Speed, position and acceleration can be limited and profiled moves using a Trajectory Generator are possible as well.
Many frequency inverters use this simple mode to control the velocity of the drive with limits and ramp functions.
The Profile Velocity Mode is used to control the velocity of the drive with no special regard of the position. It supplies limit functions and Trajectory Generation.

The profile torque mode allows a host (external) control system (i.e. closed-loop speed controller, open-loop transmission force controller) to transmit the target torque value, which is processed via the trajectory generator. The torque slope and torque profile type parameters are required.
Homming mode.

The interpolated position mode is used to control multiple coordinated axles or a single axle with the need for time-interpolation of set-point data. The interpolated position mode normally uses time synchronization mechanisms like the sync object defined in /3/ for a time coordination of the related drive units.
Operational modes
Keeping only main state bytes.

Not Ready to Switch ON:
Low level Power (e.g. 15V, 5V) has been applied to the drive.
The drive is being initialized or is running self test.
A brake, if present, has to be applied in this state.
The drive function is disabled.

Switch ON Disabled:
Drive Initialisation is complete.
The drive parameters have been set up.
Drive parameters may be changed.
High Voltage may not be applied to the drive, (e.g. for safety reasons).
The drive function is disabled.

Ready to Switch ON:
High Voltage may be applied to the drive.
The drive parameters may be changed.
The drive function is disabled

Switched ON:
High Voltage has been applied to the drive.
The Power Amplifier is ready.
The drive parameters may be changed.
The drive function is disabled.

Operation Enabled:
No faults have been detected.
The drive function is enabled and power is applied to the motor.
The drive parameters may be changed.(This corresponds to normal operation of the drive.)

Fault:
The drive parameters may be changed.
A fault has occured in the drive.
The drive function is disabled.

Fault Reaction Active:
The drive parameters may be changed.
A non-fatal fault has occured in the drive.
The Quick Stop function is being executed.
The drive function is enabled and power is applied to the motor.

Quick Stop Active:
The drive parameters may be changed.The Quick Stop function is being executed.
The drive function is enabled and power is applied to the motor. If the ‘Quick-Stop-Option-Code’ is switched to 5 (Stay in Quick-Stop), you can’t leave the Quick-Stop-State, but you can transmit to ‘Operation Enable’ with the command‘Enable Operation’
Possible States
goto ReadySwitchON
goto SwitchedON
goto SwitchONDisabled
goto QuickStopActiv
goto SwitchedON
goto OperationEnabled
goto SwitchONDisabled
Possible Control commands

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

parameterdescription.para: : Name of the CAN interface.
: Node CAN ID of the driver.
: Level of verbosity.

memberdef.argsstring: (Register reg, T val, bool force_sdo=false, bool wait=false)
memberdef.name: set

briefdescription.para: Enables to store a value in a specified registers.

parameterdescription.para: : The register to set. (In the format ind__sub)
: The value to store in the register.
: If true, the parameter will be send to the driver via a SDO. Else the parametr will be sent via PDO if it was mapped to an activated RPDO.
: If set, the function is blocking and wait for the parameter to be sent via SDO.

briefdescription.para: get Gets the value of a specified registers.

parameterdescription.para: : The register to get. (In the format ind__sub)
: If true, the parameter will be updated via a reading SDO.

simplesect.para: The value of the register in the templated format T selected.

briefdescription.para: set_control : Send transition states order.

parameterdescription.para: : Control to send.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current state of the driver by reading the status word.
wait_state loop until the driver state is different from the one passed while(actual_state()&mask) != (state&mask))

parameterdescription.para: State to wait for.
Mask to selected specific bits of the state.

briefdescription.para: set_mode Set the desired opereration mode.

parameterdescription.para: Mode to set.
Repeatidly test the actual operation mode register until it is eqaual to the selected mode.

briefdescription.para: get_mode Returns the actual operation mode of the driver.

parameterdescription.para: If set a sdo read message will be send to get the mode. Set to false to save some communication time.

briefdescription.para: set_position Send the new position to reach. Has to be in ProfilPositon mode to have some effect.

parameterdescription.para: Position to reach (in internal unit)
If set the target will be process as an absolute value. Else it will be procecced as a relative (to the current position) value.

briefdescription.para: set_velocity Send the new velocity to reach. Has to be in ProfilPositon or ProfilVelocity mode to have some effect.

parameterdescription.para: Velocity to reach (in internal unit)

briefdescription.para: set_torque Send the new torque to reach. Has to be in ProfilTorque mode to have some effect.

parameterdescription.para: Torque to reach (in internal unit)

briefdescription.para: get_position Returns the actual postion of the motor.

simplesect.para: The actual postion of the motor.

briefdescription.para: get_velocity Returns the actual velocity of the motor.

simplesect.para: The actual velocity of the motor.

briefdescription.para: get_torque Returns the actual torque of the motor.

simplesect.para: The actual torque of the motor.

briefdescription.para: set_position_offset Set the postion offset of the motor. Rq better to have a large offset to avoid letting the motor switch off in negativ position: it would result in a wrong position when restarting

parameterdescription.para: Offest of the motor in internal Unit

pause
stop

send the parameter via a Writting SDO message to the driver

parameterdescription.para: Parameter to send.

briefdescription.para: Request an update of the parameter via a Reading SDO message. (the parameter has been updated when param->sdo_flag is down.

parameterdescription.para: Parameter to update.

briefdescription.para: Enables to map the different parameters of the driver to the Transmit PDO. When a PDO is received in the T_PDO_socket() thread, the value of the pdo will be stored in the mapped parameter.

parameterdescription.para: : Function code of the PDO.
: Parameter to map.
: Slot of the parameter in the PDO message.

briefdescription.para: Sends a SDO message to activate the specified PDO.

parameterdescription.para: : N
: Node CAN ID of the driver.

briefdescription.para: Device Profile Drives and Motion Control.
